question:
Consider the following statements about the Gandhi-Irwin Pact:
  1. The British Government agreed to withdraw all ordinances and end prosecutions
  2. The Government agreed to permit tax free manufacturing of salts
  3. Gandhi agreed to participate in Second Round Table Conference
   Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Gandhi-Irwin Pact or Delhi Pact was signed on 5th March, 1931. The British Government agreed to compromise by withdrawing all ordinances and end prosecutions. Tax free manufacturing of salts was permitted by the Government. Gandhiji left his demand of complete independence and agreed to participate in Second Round Table Conference. All of the above given statements are correct.
